# Payment Service Runbook

## Overview

This runbook describes how to triage and recover the payment service when users report failed payments.

### Steps

1. Check the `payment-service` pods: `kubectl get pods -l app=payment-service -n prod`.
2. Inspect logs: `kubectl logs <pod> -n prod`.
3. If database connection errors present, restart the DB connection pool and redeploy.
4. If stuck queues are found, run the retry worker: `python workers/retry_failed_payments.py`.

### Contacts

- On-call: payments-team

ments.py`.

- On-call: payments-team@example.com

# Payment Service Runbook

## Overview

This runbook describes how to triage and recover the payment service when users report failed payments.

### Steps

1. Check the `payment-service` pods: `kubectl get pods -l app=payment-service -n prod`.
2. Inspect logs: `kubectl logs <pod> -n prod`.
3. If database connection errors present, restart the DB connection pool and redeploy.
4. If stuck queues are found, run the retry worker: `python workers/retry_failed_payments.py`.

# Payment Service Runbook

## Overview

This runbook describes how to triage and recover the payment service when users report failed payments.

### Steps

1. Check the `payment-service` pods: `kubectl get pods -l app=payment-service -n prod`.
2. Inspect logs: `kubectl logs <pod> -n prod`.
3. If database connection errors present, restart the DB connection pool and redeploy.
4. If stuck queues are found, run the retry worker: `python workers/retry_failed_payments.py`.

ster when the Save button in the above page is clicked

Step 1: Convert Image to MP4
FFmpeg first converts the input image into a very short MP4 video.

ffmpeg -y -loop 1 -i <imageUrl> -c:v libx264 -vf "pad=ceil(iw/2)*2:ceil(ih/2)*2" -b:v 600k -maxrate 900k -bufsize 2400k -t 0.06 -pix_fmt yuv420p -an <tempOutputMp4Path>

tream.

Feature  Regular video uploads (WindowsService  TmVideoProcessor)
Class - FFMPEGVIDEOEDITOR
The ffmpeg is also used in the WindowsService TmVideoProcessor and is used in the following steps:
Trim original video
Apply fade-out effect
Resize CTA image
Convert CTA image to video
Convert MP4s to TS
Concatenate all parts
Produce final MP4
This video editing p

e all parts
Produce final MP4
This video editing pipeline uses FFmpeg to trim and fade the original video, convert a CTA (Call-To-Action) image into a video clip, and then concatenate both segments using MPEG-TS for lossless merging into a final H.264 MP4 output.
1.Trim the Original Video
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <inputVideo> -ss <startTime> -t <duration> -c:v h264 -c:a aac -preset ultrafast -crf 28 <outputTrimmed.mp4>


2. Apply Fade-Out Effect (Video + Audio)
FFmpeg Command (when audio exists)
ffmpeg -i

udio)
FFmpeg Command (when audio exists)
ffmpeg -i <inputVideo> \
-filter_complex "[0:v]fade=t=out:st=<start>:d=<duration>[v];[0:a]afade=t=out:st=<start>:d=<duration>[a]" \
-map "[v]" -map "[a]" -c:v h264 -c:a aac -preset ultrafast -crf 28 <outputFade.mp4>

3.Resize CTA Image
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <inputImage> -vf scale=<width>:<height> <outputImage.jpg>

4.Convert CTA Image into Video
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -loop 1 -i <image> -c:v h264 -t <duration> \
-vf "scale=W:H:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease

vf "scale=W:H:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease,pad=W:H:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2" \
<ctaVideo.mp4>

5.Convert MP4 Files to TS (for Concatenation)
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <input.mp4> -c copy <output.ts>

6.Concatenate All Video Segments
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i "concat:file1.ts|file2.ts" -c copy <finalOutput.mp4>

Summary - The flow trims and fades the original video, converts a CTA image into a short video, and then concatenates both parts into one final MP4 using FFmpeg.

ocal pc.

deo duration is less than 5 seconds

FFmpeg command:

-ss -1 means: Seek to the last frame of the video

# Payment Service Runbook

## Overview

This runbook describes how to triage and recover the payment service when users report failed payments.

### Steps

1. Check the `payment-service` pods: `kubectl get pods -l app=payment-service -n prod`.
2. Inspect logs: `kubectl logs <pod> -n prod`.
3. If database connection errors present, restart the DB connection pool and redeploy.
4. If stuck queues are found, run the retry worker: `python workers/retry_failed_payments.py`.

# Payment Service Runbook

## Overview

This runbook describes how to triage and recover the payment service when users report failed payments.

### Steps

1. Check the `payment-service` pods: `kubectl get pods -l app=payment-service -n prod`.
2. Inspect logs: `kubectl logs <pod> -n prod`.
3. If database connection errors present, restart the DB connection pool and redeploy.
4. If stuck queues are found, run the retry worker: `python workers/retry_failed_payments.py`.

e all parts

This video editing pipeline uses FFmpeg to trim and fade the original video, convert a CTA (Call-To-Action) image into a video clip, and then concatenate both segments using MPEG-TS for lossless merging into a final H.264 MP4 output.
1.Trim the Original Video
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <inputVideo> -ss <startTime> -t <duration> -c:v h264 -c:a aac -preset ultrafast -crf 28 <outputTrimmed.mp4>


2. Apply Fade-Out Effect (Video + Audio)
FFmpeg Command (when audio exists)
ffmpeg -i

udio)
FFmpeg Command (when audio exists)
ffmpeg -i <inputVideo> \
-filter_complex "[0:v]fade=t=out:st=<start>:d=<duration>[v];[0:a]afade=t=out:st=<start>:d=<duration>[a]" \
-map "[v]" -map "[a]" -c:v h264 -c:a aac -preset ultrafast -crf 28 <outputFade.mp4>

3.Resize CTA Image
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <inputImage> -vf scale=<width>:<height> <outputImage.jpg>

4.Convert CTA Image into Video
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -loop 1 -i <image> -c:v h264 -t <duration> \
-vf "scale=W:H:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease

vf "scale=W:H:force_original_aspect_ratio=decrease,pad=W:H:(ow-iw)/2:(oh-ih)/2" \
<ctaVideo.mp4>

5.Convert MP4 Files to TS (for Concatenation)
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i <input.mp4> -c copy <output.ts>

6.Concatenate All Video Segments
FFmpeg Command
ffmpeg -i "concat:file1.ts|file2.ts" -c copy <finalOutput.mp4>

Summary - The flow trims and fades the original video, converts a CTA image into a short video, and then concatenates both parts into one final MP4 using FFmpeg.

However, this approach double-counts the same users across multiple broadcasts, because unique opens/clicks are summed per broadc

Why the Spreadsheet Formula Is Incorrect
To get an accurate open or click percentage for a tag, we cannot sum unique opens or clicks from each broadcast.
A single user may open/click multiple broadcasts with the same tag, and summing the per-broadcast numbers counts them repeatedly.
The correct calculation must be user-level, not broadcast-level.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Deduplicate users across all broadcasts for the tag, both for
total email sent
unique opens
unique clicks (already existing in production graph data)
Then compute the percentages using those actual distinct user counts.

The correct percentage =
(distinct users who opened any broadcast with the tag)  (distinct users who were sent any broadcast with the tag)
